title: Hispo
author: Hispo
content: Good morning. Some days ago I was taking a look at my twitter feedback and I found something some of you could find interesting or at leat worthy of some discussion.It seems there are slot machines of a popular japanese animation called "Madoka Magica", basically girls with magic powers, these slots machines seem to include a tactile screen for the player to interact with the characters in order to gamble.In these Tweets you can see how two of the characters seem to ask the player to "touch" their fingertips as part of the slot machine functionality. (For some reason, if the player chooses to hold on it more than necessary the character reacts to it)https://twitter.com/_jpjordon_/status/1514676095999696902https://twitter.com/Gitaka27/status/1515198419115343877What do you think about these japanese slot machines?Do you like them?Would you gamble on them?

comments.author: DaveF
comments.body: The question is does it really matter to the outcome of the game?There are slots with bonus rounds in many locations that want people to pick something on the screen.If you don't within a set amount of time the game picks for you.Depending on the location and local laws / gambling rules the picks may or may not be random. Or they may not matter at all since the result is per-determined and no matter what you pick the bonus or whatever is the same. So for something different I might give it a go, but since I'm not a slot person anyway no more or less then taking a look at any other slot and dropping in a few bucks to see what it's about.-Dave

comments.body: According to the short video on the first link, it look like a classic three reel slot machine. It's only instead of pulling the arm or pushing a button (as you do on classic machines), in this one you have to tap with your finger on the touchscreen to spin the reels.
